intro: Cordia chisimajensis, commonly known as the Chisimae cordia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red upon ripening. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Cordia chisimajensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
